                    </Stop>

request.description:
#### Changing Carrier or Shipper
---
Carrier and shipper can be changed from environment variables. For carrier we have `CARRIER_LBN` variable and for shipper we have `SHIPPER_LBN_ID` variable.

#### Changing Source and Destination locations
---
**Source Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainLoadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.
**Destination Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainUnloadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.

***NOTE***: If location is not present in location master app it will be created when the FO will be posted.

#### Overriding date values
---
All date and time used in this postman collection are generated dynamically when we post a new freight order. Overriding those values is a little tricky but possible.

e.g. if we want to change the `LOAD_BEGIN`'s `BusinessExpectedDateTime`, instead of passing the variable `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime`
we can directly pass the date/time (in this format `2021-05-22T12:20:00.000Z`). After that we must change the value of `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime` in postman's environment variable with the actual value that we have overridden with.

The above case is only applicable while overriding values in Create freight order payload. For events we can directly replace the variables with timestamp values.

item.name: Fetch JWT Token for posting events

request.description:
To get the JWT for posting events on the Freight Order, an OAuth client setup is necessary. To know more visit <<url>>.

The username and password can be set in the postman environment.

item.name: POST Load Begin Event for stop 1
POST Load End Event for stop 1
POST Unload Begin Event for stop 2
POST Unload End Event for stop 2

                    <EarliestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{UNLOAD_END_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</EarliestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                    <TechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{UNLOAD_END_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</TechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                    <LatestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{UNLOAD_END_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</LatestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                </TransportationEvent>
                <TransportationEvent>
                    <EventTypeCode>DELIVERED</EventTypeCode>
                    <Stop>
                        <ID>20</ID>
                    </Stop>
                    <EarliestBusinessExpectedDateTime>{{DELIVERED_BusinessExpectedDateTime}}</EarliestBusinessExpectedDateTime>
                    <BusinessExpectedDateTime>{{DELIVERED_BusinessExpectedDateTime}}</BusinessExpectedDateTime>
                    <LatestBusinessExpectedDateTime>{{DELIVERED_BusinessExpectedDateTime}}</LatestBusinessExpectedDateTime>
                    <EarliestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{DELIVERED_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</EarliestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                    <TechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{DELIVERED_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</TechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                    <LatestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{DELIVERED_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</LatestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                </TransportationEvent>
                <TransportationEvent>
                    <EventTypeCode>POD</EventTypeCode>
                    <LastExpectedEventIndicator>true</LastExpectedEventIndicator>
                    <Stop>
                        <ID>20</ID>
                    </Stop>
                    <EarliestBusinessExpectedDateTime>{{POD_BusinessExpectedDateTime}}</EarliestBusinessExpectedDateTime>
                    <BusinessExpectedDateTime>{{POD_BusinessExpectedDateTime}}</BusinessExpectedDateTime>
                    <LatestBusinessExpectedDateTime>{{POD_BusinessExpectedDateTime}}</LatestBusinessExpectedDateTime>
                    <EarliestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{POD_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</EarliestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                    <TechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{POD_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</TechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                    <LatestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>{{POD_TechnicalExpectedDateTime}}</LatestTechnicalExpectedDateTime>
                </TransportationEvent>
                <BusinessTransactionDocumentReference>
                    <BusinessTransactionDocumentReference>
                        <ID>DN123</ID>
                    </BusinessTransactionDocumentReference>
                    <TransportationDocumentTypeCode>BN</TransportationDocumentTypeCode>
                </BusinessTransactionDocumentReference>
                <ObjectReference>
                    <TransportationOrderID>{{TransportationOrderID}}</TransportationOrderID>
                </ObjectReference>
            </TransportationOrderGenericTrackedProcess>
        </n0:TransportationOrderGenericTrackedProcessRequest>
    </SOAP-ENV:Body>
</SOAP-ENV:Envelope>

request.description:
#### Changing Carrier or Shipper
---
Carrier and shipper can be changed from environment variables. For carrier we have `CARRIER_LBN` variable and for shipper we have `SHIPPER_LBN_ID` variable.

#### Changing Source and Destination locations
---
**Source Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainLoadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.
**Destination Location:** In the XML payload we have a property called `<MainUnloadingLocation>` which contains the details of the location.
- `<InternalID>`: value comes from the variable `SOURCE_LOC_EXT_ID` and `DEST_LOC_EXT_ID` maintained in environment variable. Make sure the environment variable's value get changed because it is reused while posting events.
- `<Address>`: this field needs to be filled manually while changing locations.

***NOTE***: If location is not present in location master app it will be created when the FO will be posted.

#### Overriding date values
---
All date and time used in this postman collection are generated dynamically when we post a new freight order. Overriding those values is a little tricky but possible.

e.g. if we want to change the `LOAD_BEGIN`'s `BusinessExpectedDateTime`, instead of passing the variable `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime`
we can directly pass the date/time (in this format `2021-05-22T12:20:00.000Z`). After that we must change the value of `LOAD_BEGIN_BusinessExpectedDateTime` in postman's environment variable with the actual value that we have overridden with.

The above case is only applicable while overriding values in Create freight order payload. For events we can directly replace the variables with timestamp values.
